cab.content:
This Document is the Property of His Britannic Majesty's Government.
SECRET.
BATTLE SITUATION - NOON - 10th SEPTEMBER. 1918.
1. WESTERN FRONT.
(a) British Front. The enemy launched a second attack yesterday evening against the position taken by us west of GOUZEAUCOURT.
He was completely repulsed.
South of HAVRINCOURT our line was slightly advanced during the night.
North-east of NEUVE CHAPELLE and west and north of ARMENTIERES our troops made slight progress.
(b) French Front. On the French Front, south of the OISE, SERVAIS STATION and BRICK WORKS were taken yesterday.
North of the OISE the following line has been reached :- LIEZ, wood north of LIEZ, MONTESCOURT, CLASTRES, ESSIGNY STATION HILL 103, (south-east of CONTESCOURT), ROUPY, ETREILLERS.
2. ITALIAN AND MACEDONIAN FRONTS.
There is nothing to report.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
10th September, 1918.
?
